Property.name: Restrictions
Property.val: Please refer to the cancer protocol cover page (www.cap.org/cancerprotocols) for information about which tumor types and procedures can be reported using this template.

DisplayedItem.name: DI_39617
DisplayedItem.title: # This checklist applies principally to adrenal carcinomas in adults. Pediatric adrenal cortical tumors have different criteria for malignancy and are, in general, treated under protocols that may differ significantly from the recommendations for adult- type tumors.

ListItem.name: LI_Urin_17-ketosteroids_increased_20900
ListItem.title: Urinary 17-ketosteroids increased (10 mg / g creatinine / 24 hours)

DisplayedItem.name: DI_57980
DisplayedItem.title: #Note: Generally due to core needle biopsy, with insufficient viable tumor to count 50 HPFs.

ListItem.name: LI_50695
ListItem.title: Tumor confined to adrenal cortex without invasion through tumor capsule (if present)

Property.name: p_rptTxt_50695_1
Property.val: Tumor confined to adrenal cortex without invasion through tumor capsule

ListItem.name: LI_39537
ListItem.title: Tumor invades into or through the adrenal capsule

ListItem.name: LI_56271
ListItem.title: Tumor invades into other adjacent organ(s)

ListItem.name: LI_52962
ListItem.title: Large vessel, renal vein (including when identified clinically)

ListItem.name: LI_59454
ListItem.title: Large vessel, vena cava (including when identified clinically)

Question.name: Q_MargUnv_Tum_Dist_26358
Question.title: Distance from Closest Margin in Millimeters (mm)

ListItem.name: LI_No_LN_Id_1868
ListItem.title: No lymph nodes submitted or found

Section.name: S_2136
Section.title: PATHOLOGIC STAGE CLASSIFICATION (pTNM, AJCC 8th Edition) (Note G)

DisplayedItem.name: DI_51087
DisplayedItem.title: Note: Reporting of pT, pN, and (when applicable) pM categories is based on information available to the pathologist at the time the report is issued. As per the AJCC (Chapter 1, 8th Ed.) it is the managing physicians responsibility to establish the final pathologic stage based upon all pertinent information, including but potentially not limited to this pathology report.

Property.name: p_rptTxt_51087_1
Property.val: Note: Reporting of pT, pN, and (when applicable) pM categories is based on information available to the pathologist at the time the report is issued. As per the AJCC (Chapter 1, 8th Ed.) it is the managing physicians responsibility to establish the final pathologic stage based upon all pertinent information, including but potentially not limited to this pathology report.

DisplayedItem.name: DI_20894
DisplayedItem.title: Note: There is no category of carcinoma in situ (pTis) relative to carcinomas of the adrenal gland.

ListItem.name: LI_pTX_2142
ListItem.title: pTX: Primary tumor cannot be assessed

ListItem.name: LI_pT0_20889
ListItem.title: pT0: No evidence of primary tumor

ListItem.name: LI_pT1_2138
ListItem.title: pT1: Tumor <= 5 cm in greatest dimension, no extra-adrenal invasion

ListItem.name: LI_pT2_2139
ListItem.title: pT2: Tumor > 5 cm, no extra-adrenal invasion

ListItem.name: LI_pT3_2140
ListItem.title: pT3: Tumor of any size with local invasion, but not invading adjacent organs

ListItem.name: LI_pT4_2141
ListItem.title: pT4: Tumor of any size with invasion of adjacent organs (kidney, diaphragm, pancreas, spleen, or liver) or large blood vessels (renal vein or vena cava)

ListItem.name: LI_pNX_2144
ListItem.title: pNX: Regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed

ListItem.name: LI_pN0_2145
ListItem.title: pN0: No regional lymph node metastasis

ListItem.name: LI_pN1_2146
ListItem.title: pN1: Metastasis in regional lymph node(s)

ListItem.name: LI_NA_20895
ListItem.title: ?Not applicable - pM cannot be determined from the submitted specimen(s)

Property.name: p_rptTxt_20895_1
Property.val: Not applicable - pM cannot be determined from the submitted specimen(s)
